title: Henry William Lett
text:
Henry William Lett (4 December 1836, <a href="Hillsborough%2C%20County%20Down">Hillsborough</a>, County Down – 26 December 1920, <a href="Aghaderg">Aghaderg</a>) was an <a href="Ireland">Irish</a> <a href="botanist">botanist</a> who specialised in <a href="moss">moss</a>es.
Lett was educated at <a href="Trinity%20College%2C%20Dublin">Trinity College</a>. He was <a href="Canon%20%28priest%29">Canon</a> of <a href="Dromore%2C%20County%20Down">Dromore</a> and a Member of the <a href="Belfast%20Natural%20History%20Society">Belfast Natural History Society</a> and a Member of the <a href="Royal%20Irish%20Academy">Royal Irish Academy</a>.
Works.
The most significant are
